creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
markings: A swastika mark is sealed in red above the title cartouche, which represents the poets circle for which this print is made.
medium: Woodblock print (surimono); ink and color on paper
text: Eguchi is the name of a river port in Osaka, which is also known for its famous gay quarter. The woman (mae shite) in picture is a ghost of the courtesan who refused to let the travelling monk, Saigyo a long time ago. The man in picture(waki) is another travelling monk came along the same place where Saigyo saw the courtesan. The red structure is a boat used by courtesans around this area to entertain their guests.
title: The River Port Eguchi
